main.name: Obi Nnaduruaku
main.bio: I am a student working towards a B.S in Computer Science at the University of Georgia. I want to expand on my programming skills by working on practical applications in a professional setting.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

education.description: Coursework: Systems Programming, Data Structures, Computer Architecture, Web Programming, Software Engineering, Computer Networks

work.title: PlantIT Web Developer (Part-Time)
work.description: Refactored API calls to the database with Vuex, decreasing homepage load times by 15%, added features to the front end of the web application using Javascript (VueJs), HTML and Sass, monitored Docker container logs and performed database migrations with Django, and maintained and updated documentation.

work.title: Application Developer Intern
work.description: Updated a user interface for an employee onboarding web application, implemented the functionality of the UI using TypeScript (React), Redux, HTML and CSS (SASS), improving overall user experience, and provided updates to senior team members while adhering to the project timeline.

work.title: Application Developer Intern
work.description: Researched wave propagation through water, analyzing data using MATLAB, and utilized SolidWorks to design 3D printed models used to test hypotheses.

projects.title: Atlanta Bookstore
projects.category: Software Engineering 4050 project, fullstack website using Javascript, HTML, CSS, SQL, and PHP

projects.title: PlantIT
projects.category: UGA Computational Plant Science Research Project (BETA)

projects.title: React Weather App
projects.category: Web app displaying temperature and current weather forecast for cities worldwide, made with React

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
